etymology.description: semantic: 氵(氵) (shuǐ, "water") + phonetic: 包(包) (bāo) = water-like appearance of foam -> bubble; foam; blister
etymology.interpretation: The character 泡(pào, "bubble; foam; blister") combines 氵(氵) (shuǐ, "water") to indicate its watery nature with 包(包) (bāo) providing the sound component, effectively representing the concept of foam or bubbles forming on water.

examples.chinese: 汤沸腾时会产生很多泡(湯沸騰時會產生很多泡)。
examples.pinyin: Tāng fèiténg shí huì chǎnshēng hěnduō pào.
examples.english: When the soup boils, many bubbles form.

examples.chinese: 他的手被烫出一个大泡(他的手被燙出一個大泡)，十分疼痛(十分疼痛)。
examples.pinyin: Tā de shǒu bèi tàng chū yīgè dà pào, shífēn téngtòng.
examples.english: His hand developed a large blister from the burn, and it hurts a lot.
